source.4d195284:
import numpy as np
import time
start_time = time.time()
#n = int(input())
n = 1000
# x=[]
# y=[]
# for ii in range(n):
#     a, b = map(int, input().split())
#     x.append(a)
#     y.append(b)
x = np.random.randint(1,100,n).tolist()
y = np.random.randint(1,100,n).tolist()
# c = list(map(int, input().split()))
c = [30, 40, 50, 5]
if len(c) == 4:
        cg = c[0:2]
        ca = c[2:4]
if len(c) == 2:
        cg=c[0:2]
        c = list(map(int, input().split()))
        ca = c[0:2]

#ncase = int(input())
ncase = n
rg = np.random.randint(10,30,n).tolist()
ra = np.random.randint(10,30,n).tolist()
for ii in range(ncase):
    # rg, ra = map(int,input().split())
    rg2 = rg[ii]*rg[ii]
    ra2 = ra[ii]*ra[ii]
    outwifi = 0
    x = np.array(x)
    dx = x-cg[0]
    dx = np.power(dx,2)
    y = np.array(y)
    dy = x-cg[1]
    dy = np.power(dy,2)
    tmp1 = dx+dy <=rg2
    dx = x-ca[0]
    dx = np.power(dx,2)
    dy = x-ca[1]
    dy = np.power(dy,2)
    tmp2 = dx+dy <=ra2
    tmp3 = tmp1 == tmp2
    indx = np.where(tmp3 == True)
    outwifi = len(indx[0])
    # print(outwifi) 
    
end_time = time.time()
print(end_time-start_time)

Jul 25, 2020, 01:00 PM WIB - Jul 25, 2020, 04:15 PM WIB. 
This code is an improved version of the code submitted to hackerearth for Shopee Programming Contest # 2 (https://www.kaggle.com/denchai/simulate-wifi-network-shopee-programming) using np.power(). 
# It is about 40 times faster.
